seniority_level.evidence: No explicit years mentioned, but requirements suggest mid-level (PySpark, Airflow, AWS S3) without senior leadership expectations

job_family.evidence: Title is explicitly 'Data Engineer' and responsibilities focus on ETL/ELT pipelines, orchestration, and cloud data infrastructure

sub_specialty.evidence: Focus on ETL/ELT pipelines, Airflow orchestration, and data quality - all batch-oriented patterns

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of managing people, mentoring, or architectural leadership - purely technical implementation role

primary_cloud.evidence: Explicitly mentions AWS and S3 as core infrastructure components

secondary_clouds.evidence: No other cloud providers mentioned in the job posting

processing_paradigm.evidence: Focus on ETL/ELT pipelines and Airflow orchestration - both batch processing patterns

orchestrator_category.evidence: Apache Airflow explicitly mentioned as the orchestration tool

storage_layer.evidence: AWS S3 mentioned as primary storage - typical data lake pattern

remote_restriction.evidence: Location restricted to 'Liege Metropolitan Area' with onsite work model

timezone_focus.evidence: Based in Liege, Belgium - clearly European timezone focus

relocation_required.evidence: Onsite work model in Liege Metropolitan Area implies relocation may be required for non-local candidates

h1b_friendly.evidence: No mention of visa sponsorship, and location is in Belgium (not US)

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of student visa support, and location is in Belgium (not US)

citizenship_required.evidence: No citizenship requirement mentioned, but onsite work in Belgium implies need for local work authorization

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Full-time permanent position in Belgium suggests standard employment contract (equivalent to W2)

benefits_level.evidence: No benefits mentioned in the job posting

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'strong growth' and 'evolution of platform' but no specific career tracks or promotion paths

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions working on 'internal dataplatform' and 'team of experts' suggesting collaboration with experienced colleagues

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotions or advancement opportunities

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers or role changes

career_tracks_available.evidence: No specific career tracks mentioned (IC, management, etc.)

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear distinction between 'must have' (PySpark, Airflow, AWS, Python, SQL) and 'nice to have' (Data Mesh) skills

scope_definition.evidence: Focused on data engineering with specific responsibilities (pipelines, orchestration, cloud, quality)

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Skills required (PySpark, Airflow, AWS S3, Python, SQL) are reasonable for a mid-level data engineer role
